main_definition: When different elements are combined or coordinated to form a coherent whole, especially when this involves incorporating various components into one system or structure.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Combining different parts or elements together
meanings_and_examples.example: The integrated curriculum combines math and science lessons.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Unified as a whole, without division or separation
meanings_and_examples.example: An integrated transportation system unites buses, trains, and subways for efficient travel.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Inclusive of people from diverse backgrounds in a society or community
meanings_and_examples.example: The school strives to be an inclusive environment where students with disabilities are integrated into regular classes.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Utilizing various technologies and systems together seamlessly
meanings_and_examples.example: A smart home is an example of a technology-integrated living space, combining voice assistants, security cameras, and automated appliances.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Merging or assimilating into a larger entity
meanings_and_examples.example: When smaller companies merge, they become integrated parts of the new conglomerate.
